Special Events
With your help, funds raised from our special events directly support vital programs for our Club members to help them succeed in school and life.
Your support provides 1,000+ kids in our community with a safe, positive place where they develop key life skills and learn what it takes to succeed academically and become good citizens.
Explore all of our special events
Consider sponsoring one of our events
By partnering with Boys & Girls Clubs of Indian River County as a sponsor, you will not only be making a positive difference in the lives of local youth but also enjoy exclusive benefits and recognition for your commitment.
For more information on events or sponsorship opportunities, email Tina Jensen at
tinajensen@bgcirc.org

Opioid Prevention Resources
At Boys & Girls Clubs, we prioritize the safety and well-being of our members. That’s why we provide monthly Opioid Prevention training to equip our young members with the knowledge and skills to make informed decisions.
For parents seeking more information and support, we've compiled a list of valuable resources and organizations dedicated to Opioid Prevention.
Resources for Parents
Understanding Opioids
What are opioids? How do I protect my family? What if my child is prescribed medication after surgery?
Check out this informative article including helpful tips for parents on how to navigate prescription and non-prescription opioid drugs with their children.
Opioid Prevention Toolkit
Explore SAMHSA's Opioid Prevention eBook for communities striving to combat the opioid crisis featuring safety advice for family members.
Tips for Talking to Your Children About Opioids
Communication is key. Research shows that parents are the leading influence on their children's decisions about substances. When parents talk about the issue, their children do hear them.
Use these ten practical tips to foster open dialogue with your children about the dangers of opioids, creating a safe space for them to share their thoughts and concerns.
Support Organizations
Discover local organizations committed to addressing substance abuse and opioid prevention.
SACIRC: Substance abuse prevention in Indian River County.
-	Programs
-	Prevention
-	Peer Support
SAFIR: Empowering the community to reduce the use of controlled substances by Indian River County youth through education, support, collaboration, and action.
-	Join the Coalition
-	Explore local events
I SAVE FL: Get the facts about opioids.
-	Prevention
-	Overdose Info
-	Find Narcan
You Can Save a Life: Overdose & Narcan Information
Click here or below to watch a video on how to administer Narcan
If you have any questions, need more information, or would like guidance on addressing opioid prevention, please
don't hesitate to reach out
. We're here to help.

Character and Leadership Development
Helping youth become responsible, caring citizens and acquire skills for participating in the democratic process is the main thrust of these programs. They empower youth to support and influence their Club and community, sustain meaningful relationships with others, develop a positive self image and good character, and respect their own and others' cultural identities. Club programs include the National Youth of the Year Recognition Program, and the Torch and Keystone Clubs.
Youth of the Year
Established in 1947, The National Youth of the Year Program is the premier recognition program for Club members, promoting service to Club, community and family; academic success; strong moral character; life goals; and poise and public speaking ability. Local Clubs recognize members ages 14 to 18 as Youth of the Month winners and select a Youth of the Year, who then participates in state competitions. State winners each receive a $1,000 scholarship and participate in regional competitions. Five regional winners each receive a $10,000 scholarship and compete on the national level. The National Youth of the Year receives up to an additional $50,000 scholarship and is installed by the President of the United States.
Torch Club
Torch Clubs are chartered, small-group leadership and service clubs for boys and girls ages 11 to 13. Through this program, Club staff can help meet the special character development needs of younger adolescents at a critical stage in their life. Torch Club members learn to elect officers and work together to implement activities in four areas: service to Club and community; education; health and fitness; and social recreation.
Keystone Club
This unique leadership development experience provides opportunities for young people ages 14 to 18. Youth participate, both in and out of the Club, in activities in three focus areas: academic success, career preparation and community service. With the guidance of an adult advisor, Keystone Clubs aim to have a positive impact on members, the Club and community. If you have seen our teenagers out volunteering in our community, it was likely through their participation in the Keystone Club.

Board of Directors
We are governed by an excellent Board of Directors, led by two Co-Chairmen, Paul Hanson and Bill Antle.
Each Board Member provides their expertise and leadership to a designated committee.
We appreciate their dedication to improving the lives of our community's children.

Alumni Association & Events
Established in 2023, the Boys & Girls Clubs of Indian River County Alumni Association is a group of BGCIRC graduates who are committed to giving back to the organization that gave so much to them.
Are you a former member? We would love for you to join us.
To request more information, please reach out to alumni@bgcirc.org.
Join the
BGCA Alumni & Friends
!
Upcoming Meetings
Annual General Body Meeting
Wednesday, Sept. 6, 2023 at 6 p.m. at the Fellsmere Club
National Events

this link
to the National BGCA page with information on events alumni can attend across the country.
